questions.text: An 10-year old girl is brought with complaints of itchy lesions on his face in 6 days. On examination, multiple ruptured blisters with Honey-Colored crusting are seen. What is likely diagnosis?
questions.explanation:
Explanation:

  • • Etiology: Streptococci and Staphylococci
  • • Age Group: Children
  • • Site: Perioral, Perianal
  • • Lesion: Golden Yellow or Honey colored Crusts
  • • Complication: Post-Streptococcal Glomerulonephritis due to Hypersensitivity reaction.

His differential diagnosis includes Cluster Headache and Paroxysmal Hemicrania. Distinguishing between this two, diagnosis could be done based on a therapeutic response to which of the following medications?

A 75-year-old male presents with an acute stroke. On examination he has mild right arm and face weakness. He has spontaneous speech with occasional paraphasic errors. He can understand and follow commands. Repetition is severely impaired. Which of the following best explains his speech pattern?
All of the following conditions are associated with Hypokalemia except?

A patient with chronic kidney disease came with complaints of vomiting and Diarrhea. His blood gas reports show pH= 7.24, pCO2: 42mm Hg, HCO3-=20mEq/L, Na+= 144mEq/L, Cl-= 100mEq/L. What is your Probable diagnosis?

options.label: A
options.text: Normal Anion Gap Metabolic Acidosis + Respiratory Acidosis

options.label: B
options.text: High Anion Gap Metabolic Acidosis + Metabolic Alkalosis+ Respiratory Acidosis

options.label: C
options.text: High Anion Gap Metabolic Acidosis + Respiratory Acidosis

options.label: D
options.text: High Anion Gap Metabolic Acidosis + Metabolic Alkalosis

questions.correct_answer: B. High Anion Gap Metabolic Acidosis + Metabolic Alkalosis+ Respiratory Acidosis
questions.explanation:
Explanation:

  • • pH= 7.24 i.e Acidosis Pco2: 42 i.e >40 Respiratory Acidosis Plasma HCO3-= 20 i.e <24 Metabolic Acidosis Metabolic Acidosis with Respiratory Acidosis: For Metabolic Acidosis always calculate Anion Gap: Anion Gap= Na+ -(Cl- +HCO3-) =144-(100+20) =145-120 = 25mEq/L Delta Ratio = AG-12 / 24-HCO3- = 25-12/ 24-20 = 13/4= >2 (Delta ratio = 1-2 (Normal): Only High Anion Metabolic Acidosis Delta ratio= <1 High Anion Metabolic Acidosis + Normal Anion Gap Metabolic Acidosis Delta ratio= >2 High anion Gap Metabolic Acidosis + Metabolic Alkalosis High Anion Gap Metabolic Acidosis + Respiratory Acidosis + Metabolic Alkalosis

options.label: A
options.text: Pain begins 3 days prior to the onset of periods and is present up to the second day of the period.

options.label: B
options.text: Pain begins after few hrs after onset of periods and can last upto 48 hrs.

options.label: C
options.text: It is dependent on psychological factors

options.label: D
options.text: GnRH antagonists are the first line of treatment

questions.correct_answer: C. It is dependent on psychological factors

questions.text: A 23-year-old female with 6 years of infertility, has a BMI of 33 and facial hair. Investigations reveal she has PCOS and spill from bilateral tubes. She and her husband are trying to conceive, what would be the best plan of management for this lady?

options.label: A
options.text: Weight loss + Metformin + Induction of ovulation with clomiphene

options.label: B
options.text: Weight loss + Metformin + Induction of ovulation with urinary gonadotropins

options.label: C
options.text: Weight loss + Finasteride + Induction of ovulation

options.label: D
options.text: Weight loss + Folic acid, Try for spontaneous induction, if failed move to induction of ovulation

questions.correct_answer: D. Weight loss + Folic acid, Try for spontaneous induction, if failed move to induction of ovulation

All of the following are complications of colles’ fracture except

A elderly female sustained Colles’ fracture in her right hand which was properly treated. She now complains of stiffness and severe pain in the wrist with cold sensation and cyanosis in the fingers. X-ray of the hand revealed complete decalcification. She is most likely suffering from –
True about lunate dislocation?

options.label: A
options.text: lunate dislocates anteriorly, while other carpal bones remains in place.

options.label: B
options.text: lunate stays in place while other carpal bones dislocates posteriorly.

questions.correct_answer: A. lunate dislocates anteriorly, while other carpal bones remains in place.

questions.text: A 5 year old male child presents with painful hip associated with a limp for past 48 hours to the department of accidents and emergency. He has a temperature of 38.5 degrees Celsius and an elevated CRP with a high white cell count .Radiographs suggest an effusion in the hip. The best step in the management would include :

options.label: B
options.text: Ultrasound guided aspiration and intravenous antibiotics

options.label: D
options.text: Emergency aspiration and washout of the hip joint followed by intravenous antibiotics

questions.correct_answer: D. Emergency aspiration and washout of the hip joint followed by intravenous antibiotics

questions.text: Which of the following is not recommended in the treatment of Acute Low back pain :
A patient with stab injury to chest. Supine Xray given. Diagnosis
Diagnosis, young adult with pain in thigh
Mount Fuji Sign seen in-

options.label: D
options.text: It is first investigation for gall stones

questions.text: Contrast that can be given in pts of chronic renal failure
Which is the shortest acting Insulin?
Drug used for Trastuzumab-Resistant her-2 positive Breast Cancer is?
Which of the following anticoagulants is considered safe to use in patients with renal failure?
FDA has approved which drug for the treatment of NASH?
questions.explanation:
Explanation:

  • • Vamorolone is a dissociative steroid being studied primarily for its effects on Duchenne muscular dystrophy. Donanemab is a monoclonal antibody designed to target amyloid beta for the treatment of Alzheimer’s disease. Lorundrostat is an aldosterone synthase inhibitor being studied primarily for conditions related to hypertension and Cushing's syndrome
